param.name: Pattern
param.span: Any expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.

span.span: Any expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.

param.name: CompareOption
param.span: Specifies how to compare strings to patterns, according to the .

span.span: Specifies how to compare strings to patterns, according to the .

param.span: Can be for binary comparison or for comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's value.

span.span: Can be for binary comparison or for comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's value.

summary.span: Compares the parameters and and returns the same results as the operator.

span.span: Compares the parameters and and returns the same results as the operator.

returns.span: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

span.span: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

returns.span: If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is .

span.span: If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is .

returns.span: If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is .

span.span: If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is .

returns.span: If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is .

span.span: If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 이 메서드는 매개 변수를 비교 `Source` 및 `Pattern` 와 동일한 결과 반환 하 고는 [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md)합니다.This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). 결과 문자열 패턴을 충족 하는지 여부를 나타내는 부울 값입니다.The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 이 메서드는 매개 변수를 비교 `Source` 및 `Pattern` 와 동일한 결과 반환 하 고는 [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md)합니다.This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). 결과 문자열 패턴을 충족 하는지 여부를 나타내는 부울 값입니다.The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. 이 메서드는 유사한 제외 하 고 항상 대/소문자 구분 이진 비교를 수행 합니다.This method is similar to except that it always performs a case-sensitive binary comparison.

returns.span: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 이 메서드는 매개 변수를 비교 `Source` 및 `Pattern` 와 동일한 결과 반환 하 고는 [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md)합니다.This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). 결과 `Boolean` 문자열 패턴을 충족 하는지 여부를 나타내는 값입니다.The result is a `Boolean` value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. 이 메서드는 비슷합니다 항상 시스템의 지정 된 대/소문자 구분 텍스트 정렬 순서에 따라 비교를 수행 한다는 `LocaleID` 값입니다.This method is similar to except that it always performs a comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's `LocaleID` value.
